image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The number of First Nations languages being actively "re-awakened" is expected to have doubled in the past five years.

title.children: Re-awakening 'actively suppressed' Indigenous languages

image.altText: The Supreme Court of the ACT has unlimited jurisdiction within the territory in civil and serious criminal matters.

props.synopsis: The 39-year-old claimed he was acting in self-defence when he set his own unit alight after years of frustration at a noisy neighbour.

title.children: Man who lit own unit on fire because of noisy neighbours sentenced

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: Stephen Maunsell later said sorry for some of the remarks he made during a court outburst, but refused to apologise to a magistrate he labelled a "raving feminist".

title.children: Man who called magistrate 'a raving feminist' found in contempt of court

image.altText: southern brush-tail rock-wallabies

props.synopsis: There are estimated to be fewer than 60 southern brush-tailed rock-wallabies left in the wild. Now a new population of the critically endangered species is being established in the ACT.

title.children: 'Crème de la crème' of animal world arrives in Canberra by plane

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University has announced its third round of job cuts as it seeks to save $250 million, and the latest proposal "touches every part of the university".

title.children: 'Touches every part of the university': ANU to cut more jobs

image.altText: A CEO with glasses

props.synopsis: The Jumbunna review recommends "priority" systemic racism reviews of ACT Policing and Canberra's jail, and an inquiry into recent deaths in custody.

title.children: 'We're not the problem, they are': Racism rife in ACT government, police

image.altText: G in front of AWM

props.synopsis: Lancaster bomber G for George carried 250 aircrew during World War II with no casualties. Now the iconic "lucky bomber" is returning to the Australian War Memorial.

title.children: Lancaster bomber G for George returns home

image.altText: A woman standing at a beach, staring into the distance with a bridge behind her.

props.synopsis: A coastal NSW council is considering replacing Cuttagee's single-lane bridge with a more efficient concrete option, but locals say they would miss the "slowness" of the historic structure.

title.children: Town fights to save 130yo timber bridge despite traffic hold-ups

image.altText: Mike Burgess wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Australia's top domestic spy chief Mike Burgess has used a speech to give his most detailed account yet of the scale of the threat of foreign interference.

title.children: ASIO disrupted 24 'major' espionage operations in three years, spy chief reveals

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a hat and no tie, addresses a crowd.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese outlines Labor's Indigenous policy focus in his fourth address to the Garma Festival as prime minister. Follow live.

title.children: PM takes aim at 'dry gully' of culture wars as he announces Indigenous policy

image.altText: Jai Culley shares a goal celebration with his mum

props.synopsis: Jai Culley kicks his first goal as a Melbourne player as the Demons kick away in the second half against West Coast. Follow live.

title.children: Returning Demon shares heartwarming goal celebration with mum

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gold Coast vs Richmond team news - No late changes
Sydney vs Essendon team news - No late changes

image.altText: Jocelyn Kelleher of the Roosters is tackled during the round five NRLW match between Wests Tigers as rain falls.

props.synopsis: The Roosters' NRLW clash with the Tigers is halted by lightning in Newcastle as Penrith looks to continue its NRL resurgence in a showdown on the Gold Coast. Follow live.

title.children: Lightning halts NRLW Magic Round as surging Panthers go for eight straight

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Blaize Talagi continues Penrith rout in Robina

image.altText: A composite picture of a cheeseburger, Donald Trump, and the US and Australia flags

props.synopsis: As the world waits to hear news about US President Donald Trump's latest tariffs, the value of Australian cows has been soaring.

title.children: Aussie cow market takes off as tariffs loom and US burger prices rise

image.altText: Three silhouettes are seen against a large windscreen of a an aircraft flying over sprawling settlement.

props.synopsis: ABC journalists have marked the moment a plane bound for Gaza crossed the line from Israeli territory into northern Gaza.

title.children: The ABC can't enter Gaza — but we can describe it from a plane

image.altText: A screenshot from the video game Rugby League 26 featuring a player from the NRLW competition.

props.synopsis: After a launch mired by bugs, server outages and criticism around player likenesses, Rugby League 26 video game developer Ross Symons defends his company and says unhappy players "should know better".

title.children: Developer of criticised NRL video game says unhappy players 'should know better'

image.altText: Tesla Model S electric car

props.synopsis: Jurors awarded the estate of Naibel Benavides Leon and her former boyfriend, Dillon Angulo, $US129 million in compensatory damages, plus $US200 million in punitive damages.

title.children: Tesla ordered to pay $375 million in fatal autopilot crash

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old man in Sydney charged with 10 counts of child sexual abuse has thrust private equity giant Quadrant into the centre of another national childcare scandal, this time in the booming out-of-school-hours sector.

title.children: Accused childcare paedophile was previously flagged to authorities

image.altText: An older white man with thin brown/grey hair wears a black suit and tie and looks serious.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signalled no shift in his stance to scale back its invasion in Ukraine despite a looming sanctions deadline from Washington.

title.children: Putin claims 'inflated expectations' around Ukraine peace talks

image.altText: A crowd of people stand around a man in a suit sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting announces it will cease operations in a massive blow to the public media network in the United States.

title.children: Major public broadcasting group to close after Trump-led funding cuts

image.altText: A man with walking sticks on a snowy mountain.

props.synopsis: Matthew Hutchinson says a school scholarship "fundamentally changed his life". He is now trekking across the US to give underprivileged kids the same opportunity.

title.children: 'Scruffy' kid who became surgeon thanks to scholarship treks to fund them for others

image.altText: Education stock image

props.synopsis: When our parliaments, newsrooms, judicial benches and many other institutions all look a certain way, it is clear who is at the centre of Australia's monoculture.

title.children: The cracks are showing in what we we tell ourselves about multiculturalism

image.altText: The president of the United States stands at a microphone and points a finger

props.synopsis: The outcome somewhat took the wind out of the sails of those who have been criticising Australia's prime minister for not getting a meeting with the US president.

title.children: Trump's tariff turmoil highlights the influence of non-trade factors

image.altText: Two 20-something women and a middle-aged man hold up a clapper board that says 'Optics'

props.synopsis: We don't want to brag but the ABC has received 44 Logie nominations this year. From deep-dive documentaries to side-splitting comedies, it would be selfish of us not to share these ABC gems for your viewing pleasure.

title.children: From big laughs to bold stories, the ABC's Logie-nominated shows are ready to binge

image.altText: a blurred photo of a man being put into handcuffs

props.synopsis: 26-year-old Michael Connors, who police allege entered the country on a fake passport, appeared in the Brisbane Arrest Court on Saturday and was charged with two migration offences.

title.children: Irish national allegedly used bedsheets to escape detention

image.altText: A woman with cropped dark curly hair stands leaning against a bright pink mural.

props.synopsis: When it comes to suicide prevention, Samantha McIntosh knows more than most, and senior lecturer Dr Anton Isaacs believes her lived experience is essential to turning the tide in Australia's mental health space.

title.children: Meet the woman pushing to turn suicide prevention on its head

image.altText: A close-up shot of a politician speaking to media.

props.synopsis: After politicising the stabbing of a 15-year-old boy at the Darwin Show, the Northern Territory government has battened down the hatches with its rhetoric. The subtext: You're either with us, or against us.

title.children: 'Gutter trash': A government hell-bent on change tears down its critics

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Victorians will be able to work at least two days a week from home under the state governments new plan to develop legal protections for employees.

title.children: Victorian government to enshrine working from home rights

image.altText: A family of three. The mum holds a black poodle and the son holds a football.

props.synopsis: After three successful organ transplants, the Stolkers say they've been given a new lease on life. Now they're campaigning for more Australians to become donors.

title.children: Organ transplants give family the 'gift of life' three times

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell faces second week in court

props.synopsis: Ghislaine Maxwell has been transferred to a lower-security prison in Texas to continue serving her 20-year prison sentence for helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse underage girls.

title.children: Ghislaine Maxwell moved from Florida prison to lower-security facility

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The US president says nuclear submarines are being repositioned in response to "provocative statements" from Russia's former president, Dmitry Medvedev.

title.children: Trump says he's moving nuclear subs in response to Russian ex-president

image.altText: A group of children, dressed in black, stand with their arms in the air, surrounded by water mist.

props.synopsis: As the atrocities in Gaza continue, another crisis is enveloping the Middle East — as record heat, drought and wildfires open up another devastating front.

title.children: Ravaged after a 12-day war with Israel, Iran is now closing in on 'day zero'

image.altText: A bone and statuette at a shrine in the Tuam graveyard in Ireland

props.synopsis: Two boys found "a jumble of bones", which sparked the discovery and now excavation of a mass grave at a mother-and-baby home run by Catholic nuns.

title.children: Mass graveyard of 800 children being excavated in Ireland

image.altText: A young girl with blonde hair smiles for the camera.

props.synopsis: A new global study has identified a hereditary link associated with stuttering, and experts have said the research will be key to providing early intervention for people who struggle with the condition.

title.children: New research tipped to be 'life-changing' for people who stutter

image.altText: A shadowed woman standing in the foreground, the ATO website in the background

props.synopsis: Financial counsellors are calling on the tax office to give small businesses and individuals more time to pay tax debts, as the level of money owed sees calls to debt helplines hit unprecedented levels.

title.children: ATO denies 'heavy-handed' tax debt collection as concerns raised

image.altText: American tennis player Jessica Pegula looks dejected after losing a point in a tournament.

props.synopsis: The Canadian Open draw opens up with the shock loss of two-time defending champion Jessica Pegula to the world's 386th-ranked player from Latvia.

title.children: Canadian Open champion Pegula beaten by world no. 386 in Montreal
